DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study compare performance investigational fluid Rapid Influenza Test BinaxNOW® Influenza A & B Test detect influenza type A influenza type B .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Fluid Rapid Influenza BinaxNOW Influenza A & B
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective study compare performance investigational fluID Rapid Influenza Test BinaxNOW® Influenza A & B Test detect influenza type A influenza type B , respect fresh nasal wash / aspirate specimen collect patient present sign symptom influenza-like illness ( ILI ) . Specimens evaluate study enrol concurrent clinical study per protocol FLU-05 , entitle `` Prospective Evaluation fluID Rapid Influenza Test '' . All subject enrol FLU-05 study consent sample use future investigation involve fluID Test . This study conduct 2008-2009 influenza season North America Hong Kong , anticipated run November 2008 May 2009 . Should influenza season conclude North America Hong Kong prior attainment minimum target enrollment specify FLU-05 study , study site Australia also enlist order enroll subject ; case , enrollment continue 2009 influenza season country , anticipated run May October , 2009 .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female subject age ; 2 . Subjects present investigative site within 4 day symptom onset , : Fever ≥ 38.0°C ( 100.4°F ) take orally , ≥ 38.5°C ( 101.2°F ) take rectally ; selfreported history fever feel feverish ( include fever control medication ) absence document fever ; One respiratory symptom influenzalike illness may include follow : Sore throat Runny stuffy nose Cough One constitutional symptom influenzalike illness may include follow : Myalgia ( ache pain ) Headache Fatigue 3 . Subjects ( parent/guardian ) willing able provide inform consent ; 4 . Subjects must enrol Arm 3 FLU05 clinical study . Written subject inform consent study protocol must obtain prior study enrollment . Each subject ( parent guardian ) must personally sign date Subject Informed Consent Form prior his/her participation clinical study . 1 . Subjects present least three symptom influenzalike illness outline . 2 . Subjects receive influenza antiviral medication investigational influenza drug treatment within previous 30 day study enrollment . 3 . Subjects ( child adult ) obtain aspirate sample contraindicate possible . 4 . Subjects medical condition prevents nasal wash aspirate sample obtain . 5 . Active duty military personnel ( participate military study site ) . 6 . Subjects ( parent/guardian ) unwilling unable provide inform consent .
